Package com.apriori.concurrent.scheduler

A ScheduledTaskManager API, which provides lots of scheduled task and job management functionality.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    RepeatingScheduledTask<V>
    Represents a repeating task.
    Rescheduler<T>
    Handles rescheduling a periodic task.
    ScheduledTask<V>
    The type of ScheduledFuture returned by submissions to a ScheduledTaskManager.
    ScheduledTaskDefinition<V>
    A TaskDefinition that has been scheduled using a ScheduledTaskManager.
    ScheduledTaskListener<V>
    A listener for completions of ScheduledTasks.
    ScheduleNextTaskPolicy<V>
    A policy that governs whether a task should be repeated or retried.
    TaskDefinition<V>
    The definition for a task that will be executed by a ScheduledTaskManager.
    TaskImplementation.Visitor<R,V>
    A visitor, for accessing the underlying task implementation using the visitor pattern.

Package com.apriori.concurrent.scheduler Description

A ScheduledTaskManager API, which provides lots of scheduled task and job management functionality. The API is based on the standard ScheduledExecutorService but with significant improvements and increased functionality. The API here allows introspection on the status and history of scheduled tasks and allows tasks to be configured with custom exception handling strategies. It also provides more control over scheduling of subsequent instances for recurring tasks, the ability to pause/resume recurring tasks, and cancel individual instances of recurring tasks.

Key Interfaces

TaskDefinition
The definition of a scheduled task. This defines when a task runs, if it is repeated and how often, what actual code is executed when the task is run, etc.
ScheduledTaskDefinition
A TaskDefinition that has been scheduled for execution with a ScheduledTaskManager. This provides additional API for inspecting the status of task invocations and controlling the task, like pausing/suspending executions and canceling the task.
ScheduledTask
A single invocation of a ScheduledTaskDefinition. If the task is defined as a repeating task, there will be multiple such invocations of this task over time. This interface is also a ScheduledFuture and is returned when submitting scheduled tasks to the executor service.
RepeatingScheduledTask
Represents all invocations of a repeating ScheduledTaskDefinition. This is for API and behavioral compatibility with the ScheduledFutures returned by the standard ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleAtFixedRate(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit) and ScheduledExecutorService.scheduleWithFixedDelay(Runnable, long, long, TimeUnit) methods.

Client code uses a TaskDefinition.Builder to construct a task and define all of the parameters for its execution. It is then scheduled with the ScheduledTaskManager for execution.
